otter.containers module¶

otter.containers.grade_assignments(tests_dir, notebooks_dir, id, image='ucbdsinfra/otter-grader', verbose=False, unfiltered_pdfs=False, tag_filter=False, html_filter=False, reqs=None, scripts=False, no_kill=False, output_path='./', debug=False, seed=None)¶

Grades multiple assignments in a directory using a single docker container.

If no PDF assignment is wanted, set all three PDF params (unfiltered_pdfs, tag_filter, html_filter) to false. Also, list any non-standard package requirements in a requirements.txt file. This function can grade files with .py or .ipynb extensions (use scripts=True for .py).

Parameters

  • tests_dir (str) – Directory of test files

  • notebooks_dir (str) – Directory of notebooks to grade

  • id (str, optional) – Id of this function for mc use

  • image (str, optional) – Docker image to do grading in

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether function should print information about various steps

  • unfiltered_pdfs (bool, optional) – Set true if no filtering needed (generate pdf of whole nb)

  • tag_filter (bool, optional) – Set true if notebook cells should be filtered by tag

  • html_filter (bool, optional) – Set true if notebook cells should be filtered by comments

  • reqs (str, optional) – Path to pip-style requirements.txt file

  • scripts (bool, optional) – Set true if we are grading .py files instead of ipython notebooks

  • (bool, optional (no_kill) – Set true to keep containers running after function terminates

Returns

A dataframe of file to grades information

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

otter.containers.launch_parallel_containers(tests_dir, notebooks_dir, verbose=False, unfiltered_pdfs=False, tag_filter=False, html_filter=False, reqs=None, num_containers=None, image='ucbdsinfra/otter-grader', scripts=False, no_kill=False, output_path='./', debug=False, seed=None)¶

Grades notebooks in parallel docker containers

This function runs NUM_CONTAINERS docker containers in parallel to grade the student submissions in NOTEBOOKS_DIR using the tests in TESTS_DIR. It can additionally generate PDFs for the parts of the assignment needing manual grading.

Parameters

  • tests_dir (str) – Path to directory with ok-style tests

  • notebooks_dir (str) – Path to student submissions to be graded against provided tests

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Set true to see logs of grade_assignments function as it runs

  • unfiltered_pdfs (bool, optional) – Set true to create PDF of entire ipython notebook

  • tag_filter (bool, optional) – Set true if notebook cells should be filtered by tag

  • html_filter (bool, optional) – Set true if notebook cells should be filtered by comments

  • reqs (str, optional) – Path to requirements.txt file with non-standard packages needed

  • num_containers (int, optional) – The number of parallel containers that will be run

  • image (str, optional) – Name of docker image used for grading environment

  • scripts (bool, optional) – Set true if student submissions are .py instead of .ipynb

  • no_kill (bool, optional) – Set true to keep containers running after function terminates

Returns

List of all dataframes which result from each container’s execution

Return type

list

otter.execute module¶

otter.execute.check(test_file_path, global_env=None)¶

check global_env against given test_file in oktest format If global_env is none, the global environment of the calling function is used. The following two calls are equivalent: check(‘tests/q1.py’) check(‘tests/q1.py’, globals())

Parameters

  • test_file_path (str) – Path to ok test file

  • (dict of str (global_env) – str, optional): A global environment resulting from the execution of a python script or notebook.

Returns

result of running the tests in the given global environment.

Return type

OKTestsResult

otter.execute.execute_notebook(nb, secret='secret', initial_env=None, ignore_errors=False, gradescope=False, cwd=None, test_dir=None, seed=None)¶

Executes an ipython notebook and return the global environment that results from execution.

Execute notebook & return the global environment that results from execution. TODO: write a note about the injection of check_results If ignore_errors is True, exceptions are swallowed. secret contains random digits so check_results and check are not easily modifiable nb is passed in as a dictionary that’s a parsed ipynb file

Parameters

  • (dict of str (nb) – str): json representation of ipython notebook

  • secret (str, optional) – randomly generated integer used to rebind check function

  • initial_env (str, optional) – name of initial environment

  • ignore_errors (bool, optional) – whether exceptions should be ignored

Results:

dict of str: object: global environment resulting from executing all code of the input notebook

otter.execute.execute_script(script, secret='secret', initial_env=None, ignore_errors=False, gradescope=False, cwd=None, seed=None)¶

Executes code of a python (.py) script and returns the resulting global environment

Execute script & return the global environment that results from execution. If ignore_errors is True, exceptions are swallowed. secret contains random digits so check_results and check are not easily modifiable script is passed in as a string

Parameters

  • script (str) – string representation of python script code

  • secret (str, optional) – secret string for naming check function

  • initial_env (str, optional) – name of initial environment

  • ignore_errors (bool) – whether exceptions should be ignored

Results:

dict: global environment resulting from executing all code of the input script

otter.execute.grade(ipynb_path, pdf, tag_filter, html_filter, script, ignore_errors=True, seed=None, cwd=None)¶

Grades a single ipython notebook and returns the score

If no PDF is needed, set the pdf, tag_filter, and html_filter parameters to false. For .py files, set script to true.

Parameters

  • ipynb_path (str) – path to the ipython notebook

  • pdf (bool) – set true if no filtering needed to generate pdf

  • tag_filter (bool) – whether cells should be filtered by tag

  • html_filter (bool) – whether cells should be filtered by comments

  • script (bool) – whether the input file is a python script

Returns

a score mapping with values for each test, student score, and total points possible

Return type

dict

otter.execute.grade_notebook(notebook_path, tests_glob=None, name=None, ignore_errors=True, script=False, gradescope=False, cwd=None, test_dir=None, seed=None)¶

Grade a notebook file & return grade

This function grades a single ipython notebook using the provided tests. If grading a .py file, set script to true.

Parameters

  • notebook_path (str) – path to a single notebook

  • tests_glob (list of str, optional) – names of test files

  • name (str, optional) – initial environment name

  • ignore_errors (bool, optional) – whether errors should be ignored, passed as an arg to execute functions

  • script (bool, optional) – true if the notebook_path is a python script, false if notebook

Returns

a score mapping with values for each test, student score, and total points possible

Return type

dict

otter.execute.main(args=None)¶

When executing this file from the command line, this function will be run.

check(question, global_env=None)¶

Checks question using gofer

Parameters

  • question (str) – Name of question being graded

  • global_env (dict) – Global environment resulting from execution of a single notebook/script (see execute.execute_notebook for more on this)

Returns

Result of running gofer.check which contains grade, failed tests, and

more related information (see gofer.OKTestsResult for more)

Return type

OKTestsResult

check_all()¶

Runs all tests on this notebook.

export(nb_path=None, export_path=None, pdf=True, filtering=True, filter_type='html', files=[], display_link=True)¶

Exports a submission to a zipfile

Creates a submission zipfile from a notebook at NB_PATH, optionally including a PDF export of the notebook and any files in FILES.

Parameters

  • nb_path (str) – Path to iPython notebook we want to export

  • export_path (str, optional) – Path at which to write zipfile

  • pdf (bool, optional) – True if PDF should be included

  • filtering (bool, optional) – Set true if only exporting a subset of nb cells to PDF

  • filter_type (str, optional) – “html” or “tags” if filtering by HTML comments or cell tags, respectively.

  • files (list, optional) – Other files to include in the zipfile

  • display_link (bool, optional) – Whether or not to display a download link

submit()¶
to_pdf(nb_path=None, filtering=True, filter_type='html', display_link=True)¶

Exports notebook to PDF

FILTER_TYPE can be “html” or “tags” if filtering by HTML comments or cell tags, respectively.

Parameters

  • nb_path (str) – Path to iPython notebook we want to export

  • filtering (bool, optional) – Set true if only exporting a subset of nb cells to PDF

  • filter_type (str, optional) – “html” or “tags” if filtering by HTML comments or cell tags, respectively.

  • display_link (bool, optional) – Whether or not to display a download link

otter.ok_parser module¶

class otter.ok_parser.CheckCallWrapper(secret)¶

Bases: ast.NodeTransformer

NodeTransformer visits and replaces nodes in place. CheckCallWrapper finds nodes with check(..) and replaces it with check_results_<secret>(check(…))

Parameters

secret (str) – Random digits string that prevents check function from being modified

Type

str

class otter.ok_parser.OKTest(name, tests, hiddens, value=1, hidden=True)¶

Bases: object

A single DocTest defined by OKPy. Instances of this class are callable. When called, it takes a global_environment dict, and returns a TestResult object. We only take a global_environment, not a local_environment. This makes tests not useful inside functions, methods or other scopes with local variables. This is a limitation of doctest, so we roll with it.

The last 2 attributes (passed, failed_test) are set after calling run().

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of test

  • tests (list of str) – List of docstring tests to be run

  • value (int, optional) – Point value of this test, defaults to 1

  • hidden (bool, optional) – Set true if this test should be hidden

name¶

Name of test

Type

str

tests¶

List of docstring tests to be run

Type

list of str

value¶

Point value of this test object, defaults to 1

Type

int

hidden¶

True if this test should be hidden

Type

bool

passed¶

True if all tests passed

Type

bool

failed_test¶

Docstring of first failed test, if any

Type

str

classmethod from_file(path)¶

Parse an ok test file & return an OKTest

Parameters

  • cls (OKTest) – Uses this to create a new OKTest object from the given file

  • path (str) – Path to ok test file

Returns

new OKTest object created from the given file

Return type

OKTest

html_result_fail_template = <Template memory:11d536518>¶
html_result_pass_template = <Template memory:11cc7e588>¶
plain_result_fail_template = <Template memory:11d5365c0>¶
plain_result_pass_template = <Template memory:11cc7e438>¶
run(global_environment)¶

Runs tests on a given global_environment.

Parameters

(dict of str (global_environment) – str): Result of executing a python notebook/script

Returns

Whether the test passed and a pointer to the current OKTest object

Return type

(bool, OKTest)

Run this object’s tests on a given global environment (from running a notebook/script)

otter.ok_parser.run_doctest(name, doctest_string, global_environment)¶

Run a single test with given global_environment. Returns (True, ‘’) if the doctest passes. Returns (False, failure_message) if the doctest fails.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of doctest

  • doctest_string (str) – Doctest in string form

  • (dict of str (global_environment) – str): Global environment resulting from the execution of a python script/notebook

Returns

Results from running the test

Return type

(bool, str)

otter.utils module¶

otter.utils.block_print()¶

Disables printing to stdout.

otter.utils.connect_db(host='localhost', username='admin', password='', port='5432', db='otter_db')¶

Connects to a specific postgres database with provided parameters/credentials

Keyword Arguments

  • host (str, optional) – Hostname for database (default localhost)

  • username (str, optional) – Username with proper read/write permissions for postgres

  • password (str, optional) – Password for provided username

  • port (str, optional) – Port on which Postgres is running

Raises

ImportError – if psycopg2 is missing

Returns

Connection object for executing sql commands on postgres database

Return type

connection

otter.utils.enable_print()¶

Enables printing to stdout.

otter.utils.flush_inline_matplotlib_plots()¶

Flush matplotlib plots immediately, rather than asynchronously. Basically, the inline backend only shows the plot after the entire cell executes, which means we can’t easily use a contextmanager to suppress displaying it. See https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/issues/1181/ and https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/10376 for more details. This function displays flushes any pending matplotlib plots if we are using the inline backend. Stolen from https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/blob/4cc15e66d5e9e69dac8fc20d1eb1d7db825d7aa2/ipywidgets/widgets/interaction.py#L35

otter.utils.hide_outputs()¶

Context manager for hiding outputs from display() calls. IPython handles matplotlib outputs specially, so those are supressed too.

otter.utils.id_generator(size=6, chars='ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789')¶

Used to generate a dynamic variable name for grading functions

This function generates a random name using the given length and character set.

Parameters

  • size (int) – Length of output name

  • chars (str) – Set of characters used to create function name

Returns

Randomized string name for grading function

Return type

str
